channel.title: Esports Kingdom
channel.description: Esports Kingdom contains articles, news, and views across multiple different esports games, focussed on weekly recaps and tournament previews/reviews.

item.title: Nuke gets a major overhaul in new CSGO update
item.description: While everyone was busy watching the cs_summit2 tournament, Valve was being sneaky beaky and dropping a new update. This update included a major overhaul for the active duty map Nuke, update for the map Canals and small improvements all around.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Overwatch League Week 2 results and rankings
item.description: The second week of Blizzard's esports league for Overwatch has come to an end with three teams still undefeated and two yet to even pick up a win. We take a look at the winners and losers this week and how that had changed the standings.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: 3 more invites for IEM Katowice and NA & EU qualifier invites
item.description: Today ESL revealed three more teams that will be attending IEM Katowice PUBG Invitational as well as the eight teams for the NA and the eight teams for the EU closed qualifiers who will each go up against eight teams from the open qualifiers.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: IEM Sydney is returning for 2018
item.description: ESL has been quiet ever since May of last year where they rocked the Qudos Bank Arena in Sydney with 7,000 attendees each day. But thanks to a post by EEAA (Exhibition & Event Association of Australia) we now know that the event will be back for 2018 and a few details.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: ESL announce 3 invites and qualifier details for IEM Katowice
item.description: ESL have been busy all over social media generating hype for their Intel Extreme Master Katowice event and the huge PUBG Invitational taking place. Today they announced three of the nine invited teams and the dates/format for the qualifiers.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: SK coldzera: "We go a lot to cheesecake factory"
item.description: SK Gaming's coldzera, the number one Counter-Strike: Global Offensive player for the second year in the row, sat down and did an AMA on r/GlobalOffensive and answered various questions between practicing for the ELEAGUE Boston 2018 Major.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Fortnite's V2.2.0 update brings a new map updates and much more
item.description: Fortnite patch V.2.2.0 is scheduled to release on January 18th, just when the Battle Royale Winter event comes to an end. The update includes new map updates for Battle Royale, battle pass bonuses and various patches to both Battle Royale and Save The World.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: 100 Thieves out of ELEAGUE Boston 2018 Counter-Strike major
item.description: 100 Thieves just announced on their Twitter that due to visa issues their team cannot compete in Boston for the ELEAGUE Counter-Strike major in the following weeks. ELEAGUE have released a statement about the empty slot left in the tournament.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Aegislash and Blastoise coming to Pokkén Tournament DX
item.description: In the Nintendo Direct Mini today we got to learn about a new Battle pack for Pokken Tournament DX featuring two new Battle Pokémon and four new Support Pokémon available for purchase right now in the Nintendo eShop on Nintendo Switch.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: ESL announce the ESL AU&NZ Championship 2018 Season
item.description: ESL returns to the Australian and New Zealand scenes in 2018 with two huge seasons expanded to sixteen teams each and branching out into DOTA 2. The CSGO stage will feature a price pool of $20,000 and the online league will be run over seven weeks.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: IEM Katowice 2018 reveal new CS:GO tournament format
item.description: Intel® Extreme Masters World Championship Katowice 2018 will be like no other IEM before. For the first time in IEM's history, we will see 16 CS:GO teams competing in the tournament. With the new number of teams we have created a new format that is different from the previous 12-team format.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: EGAA launches - New ANZ esports peak body
item.description: Today we announce the formulation of EGAA - Esports Games Association of Australia and New Zealand, a unifying peak body for the esports industry.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: 'The Rad Scientist' Dr. Coyle joins ARMS + New Party Crash
item.description: Today’s launch of version 5.0 adds another playable pugilist in the form of Dr. Coyle, bringing the total roster to 15 characters, including stalwarts Master Mummy and Twintelle who will duke it out in the next online Party Crash event happening from Saturday 30th December.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Faker, Cloud9 and Overwatch come up big at The Game Awards 2017
item.description: Esports took center stage during the fourth incarnation of Geoff Keighley's award ceremony. Three awards at the event were dedicated to esports; 'Best eSports Game', 'Best eSports Team' and 'Best eSports Player' as voted on by the fans.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Fast cars and racing pods! - Let's Play Live GT Sport
item.description: Thanks to Let's Play Live, Grady was able to attend the Gran Turismo Sport event at the SKYCITY Theatre. There was some awesome cars to look at and some great players and celebrities playing in racing pods to try and get the best times on the Bathurst track.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: DEVIL to Team LDLC and other changes (19 June - 25 June)
item.description: There has been a lot of roster movement in professional Counter-Strike scene in the past ten days both worldwide and in the Oceania region with new teams being formed, old teams being dropped and players switching teams.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: Astralis kjaerbye: "One game at a time and just play our hearts out"
item.description: Astralis may not have made it to the grand final of IEM Sydney, but they still put on a great showing making it to the semi-finals in the big stage. At the event Grady got to have a chat with star player kjaerbye about sightseeing in Australia and his preferred finals format.
item.author: Grady Hooker

item.title: SK fer: "It is an incredible crowd and they love this game"
item.description: After the grand finals at the Intel Extreme Masters Sydney tournament, Grady got to sit down with tournament winner fer to talk about SK Gaming's preparation coming into the tournament, hot off a win at cs_summit, and the best-of-five final against FaZe Clan.
item.author: Grady Hooker
